docs.title: Privacy Policy
docs.text:
This page summarizes the privacy policies of each project we work on.

Kamus Madura

docs.title: Kebijakan Privasi
docs.text:
Terakhir diperbaharui: 2 Juni 2022

Halaman ini menjelaskan bagaimana "Vizard Labs" (selanjutnya disebut "kami") mengumpulkan, menggunakan, dan mengungkapkan data pribadi pengguna (selanjutnya disebut "Anda"). Kebijakan ini terbatas untuk "Kamus Madura" (selanjutnya disebut "aplikasi") dalam hal penggunaannya. Dengan memasang aplikasi kami pada perangkat Anda, maka Anda telah setuju dan menerima segala hal yang kami uraikan.

docs.title: 1. Pasal Sanggahan
docs.text: Aplikasi kami bersifat gratis (tidak dipungut biaya sepeser pun), kami tidak bertanggung jawab atas ketidaksesuaian data atau kesalahan informasi yang muncul dalam aplikasi. Data dikumpulkan dan disusun secara mandiri dan sukarela, kami tidak dibayar maupun menerima bayaran dalam proses pembuatannya.

docs.title: 2. Pengumpulan Data
docs.text:
Tidak ada data pribadi atau data sensitif yang kami kumpulkan. Aplikasi bersifat luring (offline) dan tidak memerlukan registrasi pengguna. Adapun data yang kami kumpulkan, di antaranya:

a) riwayat pencarian kata, b) markah / kata favorit, c) data pengaturan antarmuka aplikasi, d) data perbaikan kosakata dan kosakata baru.

docs.title: 3. Layanan Pihak Ketiga
docs.text: Beberapa fitur aplikasi memungkinkan Anda untuk membagikan konten kepada kami melalui Layanan Pihak Ketiga seperti "Google Formulir" milik Google. Anda dapat memilih untuk turut serta dalam menyumbangkan perbaikan dan kosakata baru, atau memilih untuk mengabaikan fitur tersebut.

docs.title: 4. Bagaimana Kami Menggunakan Informasi
docs.text: Segala informasi yang kami terima akan dipelajari terlebih dahulu. Dalam hal ini, khususnya perbaikan dan kosakata baru. Data yang bersifat layak akan diikutsertakan dalam versi aplikasi berikutnya. Kami tidak memiliki batasan waktu atau kepastian mengenai kapan informasi yang diterima selesai diproses.

docs.title: Cherry-Picking a Specific Commit
docs.text: Cherry-picking allows you to select a single commit from one branch (or repository) and apply it to your branch.

docs.title: 1. Add the remote repository
docs.text:
Add the remote repository from which you want to cherry-pick the commit.

Example
git remote add <remote-name> https://github.com/username/repo.git
  • Replace remote-name with the branch name.
  • Replace username/repo with the username and repository you want to pull from.

docs.title: 2. Fetch the latest changes from the remote
docs.text:
Example
git fetch <remote-name>

docs.title: 3. Find the commit hash
docs.text: You need to know the commit hash you want to cherry-pick. You can find the hash in the other repository's commit history.

docs.title: 4. Cherry-pick the commit
docs.text:
Example
git cherry-pick <commit-hash>

docs.title: 5. Resolve conflicts
docs.text: If there are any merge conflicts, Git will prompt you to resolve them.

docs.title: 6. Push the changes
docs.text:
After cherry-picking the commit and resolving conflicts, push the changes to your repository.

Example
git push origin <branch-name>
  • Replace branch-name with your actual branch name (e.g., master).

docs.title: How to Install Android App via AppTester
How to Install iOS App via TestFlight
docs.text: TestFlight lets developers share beta apps with users for testing.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text: To test beta versions of apps using TestFlight, you’ll need to accept an email invitation from the developer and have a device that you can use to test.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• iPhone or iPad running iOS 14 or iPadOS 14 or later
  • an email used as an Apple ID

Important

To avoid confusion, please make sure the email you use as your Apple ID is only associated with one person and one Apple device.

docs.title: Step 1: Install TestFlight App
docs.text:
Download the TestFlight app from the App Store by searching for “TestFlight” or tap the direct link in your mobile device: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/testflight/id899247664

Once installed, open TestFlight and just follow the Welcome dialog by tapping “Continue”.

docs.title: Step 2: Accepting “Development Team” Invitation
docs.text:
Accept the invitation by tapping the "Accept Invitation" link in your email.

Example

docs.title: Step 3: Accepting “App” Invitation
docs.text:
1. Accept the invitation by tapping the "View in TestFlight" link in your email.
  2. Follow the prompts in TestFlight by tapping "Accept" and then "Install".
  3. Wait for the app to install, and then tap "Open".
Example

docs.title: Install Command Line Tools for Xcode
docs.text:
1. Open Software Update
  2. On Additional downloads section, find an options to download/install Command Line Tools for Xcode

After the installation is complete, try to run: xcodebuild -version

If you encounter an error:

  1. Open Xcode > Settings
  2. Open Locations tab
  3. Re-select your Xcode version on Command Line Tools field

docs.title: Generating a build
docs.text:
To build for debuging on emulator: Example

cordova emulate ios

To build for release (device required): Example

Please use Xcode > Product > Archive

docs.title: References
docs.text: • https://cordova.apache.org/docs/en/latest/guide/platforms/ios

docs.title: Preparing Environment Variables for Android Development
docs.text:
Environment variables are required to build apps using the Command Line Interface (CLI).

Variable Description ANDROID_HOME Android SDK location JAVA_HOME Java SDK location

docs.title: Get value on Windows
docs.text:
ANDROID_HOME
  1. Download Android Studio and install
  2. Open Android Studio
  3. Open File -> Project Structure -> SDK Location
  4. Copy Android SDK location Example
    C:\Users\<user_name>\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk
JAVA_HOME
  1. Download JDK 11 (required version) and install
  2. Copy JDK location Example
    C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-11

Compatible Version

If you are developing a Cordova project alongside CapacitorJS, then please use JDK 17.

docs.title: Set value on Windows
docs.text:
1. Open System Properties
  2. Open Advanced tab
  3. Click Environment Variables button
  4. On System Variables section, click New
  5. Input Variable name and Variable value
  6. Click OK

docs.title: Generating a build
docs.text:
To build for debuging (apk): Example

cordova build android

To build for release (aab): Example

cordova build android --release

docs.title: How to verify a build
docs.text:
To ensure there are no errors when submitting your app to the store, its strongly recommended to verify the build. The verify result is sometimes necessary for penetration testing requirements.

  1. Add new Path value in System Variables to expose apksigner Example

    C:\Users\<user_name>\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk\build-tools\34.0.0

  2. Open Terminal and run apksigner Example

    apksigner verify --verbose --print-certs <file_name>.apk

docs.title: References
docs.text: • https://cordova.apache.org/docs/en/latest/guide/platforms/android

docs.title: Use case
docs.text:
• Users must register their biometric data in their OS settings (not in your apps).
  • All registered biometric data of different people in one device is valid for use.

docs.title: Scenario 1: First time install
docs.text:
1. User download the app
  2. User open the app
  3. User navigate to login page
  4. User tap "Biometric login" button
  5. Show message:

Dialog

Biometric login has not been activated on your device. Please log in and activate it on "Preferences" page.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Activating biometric login
docs.text:
1. User log in with regular username and password
  2. User navigate to "Preferences" page
  3. User tap "Biometric login" option (checkbox)
  4. App will send credentials to server: username + password + deviceId
  5. Server will issues a long-live refresh token
  6. Refresh token will be saved by using the function below:
biometric.ts
const refreshToken = 'xxxxx.yyyyy.zzzzz'

await Fingerprint.registerBiometricSecret({
    secret: refreshToken
})

docs.title: Scenario 3: Login with biometric (after the activation)
docs.text:
1. User open the app
  2. User navigate to login page
  3. User tap "Biometric login" button
  4. Authenticate the user using biometry (fingerprint or faceId)
  5. If authenticated, load refreshToken from the biometric registry and send it to the server
  6. Server exchanges refreshToken for a valid access-token
biometric.ts
const secret = await Fingerprint.loadBiometricSecret()
const credential = JSON.parse(secret)

// POST api/v2/token

docs.title: Scenario 1: User log in with different fingers
docs.text:
1. User activate the biometric login feature in "Preferences" page using their thumb
  2. User try to log in using another registered finger

Result

Log in success

docs.title: Scenario 2: User register new fingers
docs.text:
1. User activate the biometric login feature in "Preferences" page using their thumb
  2. User go to OS settings, then register new finger
  3. User go back to app, then try to log in

Result

Log in failed

docs.title: Dependencies
docs.text:
• https://www.npmjs.com/package/cordova-plugin-fingerprint-aio
  • https://www.npmjs.com/package/@awesome-cordova-plugins/fingerprint-aio (optional)

docs.title: Facebook Login
docs.text: To setup Facebook Login for your apps, you need to create a Facebook Developer Account at https://developers.facebook.com.

docs.title: Installing Facebook Plugin for Cordova
docs.text:
This plugin is a fork of the official plugin for Facebook in Apache Cordova that implements the latest Facebook SDK.

Source: https://www.npmjs.com/package/cordova-plugin-fbsdk

Known Issue: https://github.com/facebook/facebook-android-sdk/issues/1191

Fixed:

  • Use https://github.com/ipunkvizard/cordova-plugin-fbsdk

  • Please install the Android build tools version 30.0.3.

docs.title: Setting up the required variables
docs.text: Variable How to find APP_ID Settings -> Basic -> App ID APP_NAME Settings -> Basic -> Display name CLIENT_TOKEN Settings -> Advanced -> Client token

docs.title: Generating the key hashes for development (Android)
docs.text:
1. Get your app SHA1 key by running gradle signingReport.

SHA1
A9:3A:F5:45:68:EA:80:66:27:7D:C2:83:DD:9D:EB:5B:5C:02:92:EB

2. Remove the ":" separator from the key.

SHA1 (Without separator)
A93AF54568EA8066277DC283DD9DEB5B5C0292EB

3. Find any free Hex to Base64 converter.

Base64
qTr1RWjqgGYnfcKD3Z3rW1wCkus=

Alternative: http://tomeko.net/online_tools/hex_to_base64.php

docs.title: How to test
docs.text:
• Android: assign a tester in development mode.
  • iOS: switch to live mode (somehow the facebook login is not working in development mode).

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: SSL Pinning is a security technique that makes sure that a specific SSL/TLS certificate is always used for a website or application. It prevents attackers from using fake certificates to intercept and read encrypted traffic. It's commonly used in mobile apps to protect sensitive data.

docs.title: How it works?
docs.text:
SSL Pinning works client-side and verifies the server certificate by comparing hashes of public keys that are pre-bundled with the mobile app.

By design, if there's a hash mismatch, calls to server actions stop working. If there's a hash mismatch, you must add a new hash list in the app, build a new version of the app, and distribute it to your users.

docs.title: Implementation
docs.text:
Disclaimer

The following implementation is limited to Cordova applications only.

Cordova does not support true certificate pinning. The main barrier to this is a lack of native APIs in Android for intercepting SSL connections to perform the check of the server's certificate.

More information

To implement SSL pinning in hybrid apps, you can follow these general steps:

  1. Identify the SSL certificate used by the server.
  2. Integrate SSL pinning plugin for Cordova.
  3. Hard-coded the certificate's public key or hash to the app's code.
  4. Validate.

docs.title: Additional Operations
docs.text:
These operations are required if you decide to implement SSL Pinning.

  • Identify current SSL certificate

    1. Open Google Chrome. 2. Type your website URL in address bar. 3. Open Developer Tools or hold the Ctrl+Shift+I, then go to Security tab. 4. Tap View certificate button. 5. Find SHA-256 Fingerprint.

  • Identify renewed SSL certificate

    1. Install openssl. 

    choco install openssl

    2. Get your new certificate in .crt format. 3. Generate certificate fingerprint.

    openssl x509 -noout -fingerprint -sha256 -inform pem -in [certificate.crt]

  • Converting certificate (.pfx to .crt)

    1. Install openssl. 

    choco install openssl

    2. Extract .crt file from the .pfx certificate (password is required).

    openssl pkcs12 -in [certificate.pfx] -clcerts -nokeys -out [certificate.crt]

    3. Generate certificate fingerprint.

    openssl x509 -noout -fingerprint -sha256 -inform pem -in [certificate.crt]

  • Resubmit android app to Play Store

    No explanation needed.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
• Pros

    SSL pinning provides extra security against attackers who try to intercept encrypted traffic. It makes it harder for attackers to steal sensitive information and can also improve the performance and reliability of the application.

  • Cons

    SSL pinning will make it more difficult to manage SSL/TLS certificates. If a certificate needs to be changed, updated or renewed, the client application needs to be updated as well, which can cause inconvenience for users and make the maintenance process more complex.

docs.title: Operating System (OS)
docs.text:
Effective as of 02 February 2022

Android 9.0 iOS/iPadOS 14.0

docs.title: Specification
docs.text:
The url scheme consists of 14 digit characters.

Digits Subject Example Description 2 country id Indonesia ph Philippines 3 brand mit Mitsubishi nsn Nissan tyt Toyota 2 environment qa QA ua UAT pr Production 2 product cs Customer ss Sales cc Circle Check 5 project name mmpc0 MMPC (add '0' to make 5 digits) npi00 NPI (add '00' to make 5 digits) tunas Tunas

Example

  • idyanqacsotole:
  • idyanqassotole:
  • idyanqaccotole:

docs.title: How to Test
docs.text:
Please update your client apps to the latest version before testing, then open this page in your mobile browser.

OTONPI App URL Scheme Customer (QA) qaotoleapcs: Open qaotoleapcs:user/bookings Open Sales (QA) qaotoleapsl: Open qaotoleapsl:lead Open CircleCheck (QA) qaotoleapcc: Open qaotoleapcc:check-in Open App URL Scheme Customer (QA) phnsnqacsnpi00: Open phnsnqacsnpi00:user/bookings Open Customer (UAT) phnsnuacsnpi00: Open phnsnuacsnpi00:user/bookings Open Customer (Prod) phnsnprcsnpi00: Open phnsnprcsnpi00:user/bookings Open

docs.title: How to Share Access
docs.text:
1. Go to App Store Connect. 2. Log into your developer account. 3. Go to Users and Access.

4. Click (+) to add new user.

Input First Name Technosoft Last Name Automotive Email technosoftautomotive@icloud.com Roles Admin Apps All Apps

5. Click Invite to proceed.

docs.title: Apple Business Manager
docs.text: In order to publish private apps, Apple Business Manager is required to setup by client.

docs.title: Enroll in Apple Business Manager
docs.text:
1. Go to Apple Business Manager. 2. Please complete the form, then continue.

3. It may take up to 5 days for your enrollment to be completed.

docs.title: Find Organization name and Organization ID
docs.text: 1. Go to Apple Business Manager. 2. Log into your Apple Business Manager account. 3. Go to Settings page. 4. Find your Organization name and Organization ID, then send it to us.

docs.title: Generating Redemption Codes for Distribution
docs.text:
This step can only be done after your apps has been reviewed by Apple.

1. Go to Apple Business Manager. 2. Log into your Apple Business Manager account. 3. Go to Custom Apps page. 4. Click Get Started, then you will be asked to login once again.

BeforeAfter

Important

This process is very slow, when we try it ourselves, the process is stuck as if nothing happened. But after a few minutes, the contents changed.

5. Select your app, fill the form as your needed, then click Get.

6. Please wait for an email from Apple. 7. Download button should appear as below.

docs.title: How to Redeem a Code
docs.text:
This step can only be done after your apps has been reviewed by Apple.

After obtaining an excel file from Apple Business Manager which contains the list of redemption codes, you can start to download the apps by following these steps.

1. On your iPhone/iPad, open the AppStore. 2. Go to Account.

3. Tap Redeem Gift Card or Code.

4. Enter the code manually, then tap Redeem.

5. Please wait for the download process to complete.

6. Done.

docs.title: Service Limitation
docs.text:
• The codes only work on devices with the same region, for example: your redemption code is generated by a company in Philippines region, so the devices must be in Philippines region too.

    • How to change your Apple ID country or region

  • Each code only work once, so use different code for each devices.

  • Please check for supported region before enrolling.
  • Not supported in Indonesia.

docs.title: FAQ
docs.text:
Why we can't distribute the app in different regions?

  • Apple Business Manager redemption links showing region error
  • Distribute Custom App from Apple Business Manager outside your country
  • Distribute Custom App via VPP redemption codes at scale
  • VPP Redeemable Codes in different countries

docs.title: How to Share Access
docs.text:
1. Go to Google Play Console. 2. Log into your developer account. 3. Go to Users and permissions.

4. Click Invite new users.

Input Email address technosoft.otoleap@gmail.com App access Admin (all permissions)

docs.title: How to Share Access
docs.text:
1. Go to AppGallery Connect. 2. Log into your developer account. 3. Go to Users and permissions.

4. Click Add to add new user.

Important

By clicking "Add" button, you will be redirected to HUAWEI Developers (Team Account) page.

5. Click Add member account.

Input Account type Email Account technosoft.otoleap@gmail.com Member name Technosoft Automotive Contact email technosoft.otoleap@gmail.com Access expires Never Send emails in English

Input Roles System management (Administrator)

6. Click Next, then Submit.

How to Sign Up
docs.text: 1. Go to Sign Up.
